lead_paragraph: A dock installed off the shoreline of Bay Ridge, Brooklyn, was damaged after one season, and some have criticized it for being poorly designed.

headline.print_headline: Damaged After One Season, a Public Dock in Brooklyn Is Now Used Only by Birds
headline.main: $1.1 Million Brooklyn Dock, Built for Public Use, Sits in Storage

snippet: A dock installed off the shoreline of Bay Ridge, Brooklyn, was damaged after one season, and some have criticized it for being poorly designed.
abstract: Eco Dock sits seven miles out in Sheepshead Bay,  towed there for storage after only one season of operation off Bay Ridge, Brooklyn's shore; locals theorize cause of $1.1 million public dock's rapid deterioration was poor design; New York City's parks department, which has authority over structure, says it cannot give timeline for repairs.
